body: At least for the past few months, everywhere I go on ruqqus people seem to have a huge fetish for men being "men" and dominating their women. I don't really care but it seems to prevail almost universally on ruqqus for some reason, in a manner similar to how almost everyone on deviantart and twitter is a furry. It can become annoying when it begins to invade serious discussion though. For instance I just saw a post complaining that female soldiers exist. People often even express disappointment that girls sports are a thing. And any time someone suggests that women beat men in anything, the bandwagon attacks it and insists otherwise with zero evidence but their kink. It seems like ruqqus is obsessed with the female being weak and dominated by the male, to the point where they think the whole world should be set up and legislated to reflect their fetish. This isn't abnormal (though to the degree of wanting to impose it on everyone is) but I wonder why it's so prevalent here? There are obvious reasons why art sites tend to attract furries and weebs, but I'm confused about how discussion forums attract "alpha males" so much.

body:
I don't see this as any kind of fetish. It's simply because conservatives tend to think (more compared to progressives and other groups) that men outperform women in physical strength, that they put on a better show in most sports, that women are worth protecting instead of sending them to the battle etc. Now because conservatives have been largely driven out of places like reddit or twitter you'll find their opinions prevail in whatever place where they find refuge. Ruqqus in this case. Without social media censorship these opinions would be mixed together with other opinions across various platforms.

It's like asking why Twitter user base is so obsessed with mental illnesses and being furries. After people with other views were kicked out they are all that is left.

post.body: At least for the past few months, everywhere I go on ruqqus people seem to have a huge fetish for men being "men" and dominating their women. I don't really care but it seems to prevail almost universally on ruqqus for some reason, in a manner similar to how almost everyone on deviantart and twitter is a furry. It can become annoying when it begins to invade serious discussion though. For instance I just saw a post complaining that female soldiers exist. People often even express disappointment that girls sports are a thing. And any time someone suggests that women beat men in anything, the bandwagon attacks it and insists otherwise with zero evidence but their kink. It seems like ruqqus is obsessed with the female being weak and dominated by the male, to the point where they think the whole world should be set up and legislated to reflect their fetish. This isn't abnormal (though to the degree of wanting to impose it on everyone is) but I wonder why it's so prevalent here? There are obvious reasons why art sites tend to attract furries and weebs, but I'm confused about how discussion forums attract "alpha males" so much.

body:
Hate to burst your pride bubble but pretty much anything that isn't physio-spatial women have so much more potential. It's all down to how brains are configured and what tasks people are meant for. Biologically, males serve primarily 2 functions: sperm donor and provide/protect. It's a nasty role and not very fun but someone has to do it. Males lose their childhood "sponge" learning and enormous creativity over time in exchange for physio-spatial skills, while girls develop them further. You may wonder why one sex is more well rounded and the other overspecializes so much in just this one area, but in ancient times physical strength was a BIG deal. But it is a fact that male brains are designed to be good at perceiving pain, becoming angry and demanding justice, and noticing moving objects, and female brains are designed to be good at logic, creativity, and nurturing, and considering the historical roles of each, this setup makes perfect sense, fair or not.

There is a common misconception that males are more variable and excel both at being god awful at something or insanely good, while women are more centered around the average. Males being more variable is true, however technically female abilities average far higher than male ones, as shown by brain scans. The reason they often don't achieve as much is that men are more competitive and more likely to try and turn a hobby into a career or financial success, whereas women tend to do things more just for fun in private. The other reason is that, also due to primal instincts, society coddles girls and is too harsh on boys. Boys, even from a young age, must NEVER cry, NEVER fail, NEVER make mistakes, etc. while girls are allowed to basically have temper tantrums over the smallest things and be comparatively lazy (as they are not required to provide for themselves like men). What this results in is that boys are constantly worrying about doing their job well enough, while girls concern themselves with gossip and makeup which of course is going to make them stupid; the fact that they maintain average intelligence doing this is amazing. However, the ones that have enough interest to push themselves even a little bit are fucking savants; the highest IQ on record is in fact a woman's. This reflects my personal experience pretty well also, if you ask for 10 geniuses, you'll get 9 men but one girl who is more brilliant than half of them combined. Female is definitely the superior sex when it comes to natural talent, you'll see a man talented in one or two things every once in a while but the *majority* of girls have a ton of talents, some seem to be talented at every single thing there is; whether they tend use them or waste them is another story.

post.body: At least for the past few months, everywhere I go on ruqqus people seem to have a huge fetish for men being "men" and dominating their women. I don't really care but it seems to prevail almost universally on ruqqus for some reason, in a manner similar to how almost everyone on deviantart and twitter is a furry. It can become annoying when it begins to invade serious discussion though. For instance I just saw a post complaining that female soldiers exist. People often even express disappointment that girls sports are a thing. And any time someone suggests that women beat men in anything, the bandwagon attacks it and insists otherwise with zero evidence but their kink. It seems like ruqqus is obsessed with the female being weak and dominated by the male, to the point where they think the whole world should be set up and legislated to reflect their fetish. This isn't abnormal (though to the degree of wanting to impose it on everyone is) but I wonder why it's so prevalent here? There are obvious reasons why art sites tend to attract furries and weebs, but I'm confused about how discussion forums attract "alpha males" so much.

body:
Basically, yeah, the gender of wasted potential. However it's mostly a result of them being coddled and allowed to be lazier. Boys are not allowed to fail or show any weakness whatsoever, even as infants parents neglect their baby boys more than girls. Boys are held to higher expectations in school, not allowed to cry, expected to be tough and never need help, and will face punishment by both peers and authority figures if they fail. Even when they get to the point of being suicidal, parents will most likely try to punish it out of them. Boys are expected to go to work and provide for themselves and likely a family, and deal with their problems at their own expense. Boys are also required to sign up for the draft. Meanwhile girls are shown support no matter how whiny they are, and are not expected to deal with as much stress or accomplish as much. They are allowed to make mistakes. Since very few will work at something if they don't have to, this results in girls being absorbed in meaningless gossip and makeup shows. Basically, men still have to do everything for women, even when the women can do it far better than they can. Men have to do far more to survive. If the sexes were subject to equal treatment you'd see just how far behind males are in 90% of the mental realm. The fact that females still maintain the same average intelligence as males in this situation is itself remarkable.

I think you're just locked in your mindset of "men are always superior at everything no exceptions" the same way the media refuses to acknowledge that there are fundamental biological differences between the sexes, and men are designed for all the non-enjoyable dirtywork most of which isn't even relevant in the modern world. I'm male, do you really think I *want* this to be the case? It just is what it is.
